Quotes.title: Jordan Peterson
Quotes.content: There are cathedrals everywhere for those with the eyes to see.

Quotes.title: Carl Sagan
Quotes.content: We are like butterflies who flutter for a day and think it is forever.

Quotes.title: Man's Search for Meaning
Quotes.content: No man should judge unless he asks himself an absolute honesty whether, in a similar situation, he might not have done the same.

Quotes.title: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Quotes.content: There is only one thing that I dread: not to be worthy of my sufferings.

Quotes.title: Spinoza's Ethics
Quotes.content: Emotion, which is suffering, ceases to be suffering as soon as we form a clear and precise picture of it.

Quotes.title: Richard Feynman
Quotes.content: Study hard what interests you the most in the most undisciplined, irreverent, and original manner.

Quotes.title: Dumbledore
Quotes.content: Words are, in my not-so-humble opinion, our most inexhaustible source of magic. Capable of both inflicting injury and remedying it.

Quotes.title: Dune
Quotes.content: Deep in the human unconscious is a pervasive need for a logical universe that makes sense. But the real universe is always one step beyond logic.

Quotes.title: Miyamoto Musashi
Quotes.content: If you know the way broadly, you will see it in everything.

Quotes.title: Albert Einstein
Quotes.content: God doesn’t play dice with the universe.

Quotes.title: Neils Bohr
Quotes.content: Einstein, stop telling God what to do.

Quotes.title: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quotes.content: The line between good and evil runs through the heart of every man.

Quotes.title: Dune: Messiah
Quotes.content: The convoluted wording of legalisms grew up around the necessity to hide from ourselves the violence we intend toward each other. Between depriving a man of one hour from his life and depriving him of his life there exists only a difference of degree. You have done violence to him, consumed his energy. Elaborate euphemisms may conceal your intent to kill, but behind any use of power over another the ultimate assumption remains: ‘I feed on your energy.’

Quotes.title: Waymond Wang (Everything Everywhere All At Once)
Quotes.content: Even though you broke my heart yet again, in another life I would’ve really liked just doing laundry and taxes with you. I’m not kind because I’m naive; I’m kind because it’s strategic and necessary.

Quotes.title: William Shakespeare
Quotes.content: A rose by any other name would smell as sweet.

Quotes.title: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quotes.content: If you gaze long enough into the abyss, the abyss gazes back into you.

Quotes.title: Jordan Peterson
Quotes.content: You have very little right to break rules, until you have mastered them.

Quotes.title: Proverbs 3:5-6
Quotes.content: In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths.

Poems.content:
I would give anything for your friendship
You have no idea
 I would take a bullet just to let you live
You're worth it
The countless drinks and times we had
They'll lift me up to Heaven
And when I'm gone I'll bless you all the way
Your guardian all the way
All the way until our next lives
All the way
You brought me more than could fit into one life
Memories I wish I could sink into forever
You marks on my soul age like leather
I'll love you forever

I can't even complain
Just look what you've become
It's too bad it ain't with me
I'll drop the roses by your feet
Why would I pay for your ring
When I could go to jail for free
And at the rate neighbors hate
I think that's where I'm bound to be
I'll make you believe that you're blessed
While I relieve all your stress
Cause ain't a damned thing different
About me when you're present
Like a gift like a beverage
That we share in the basement
Exchanging funny faces
How the fuck did we make
Well I can't count all the smiles
And I can't count the laughs
But I hope you remember all the times we had
I know I will

I was a rock climber
Down in Utah where I thrive
Orange canyons run for miles
Like a scene from the wild west 
I’ll take the old mountain road

Insights.content: Curiosity is the first victim of overstimulation.
Worry not about the language of your visions, but rather the connection of your visions to present sensations.
All I do is sit and dream about who I could be.
Your love is given in the shape of your personality.
From your stay in the wilderness, you take something with you in your heart that guides you thereafter.
Woven into the fabric of beauty is the nature of truth.
We live in such a beautiful world: physically, but also in the minds we inhabit. The depth of your eyes runs as deep as the ocean.
Be present, accept your burden, and give energy.
Be alive, accept the blues, pay forward the blessings from men before you.
